SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Lights
Class PointLight

java.lang.Object
  SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Node
      SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Lights.Light
          SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Lights.PointLight
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGL_Renderable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SpotLight
public class PointLight
extends Light

This class represents lights that have a particular position in the 3D virtual world. The position and the way that the light intensity is attenuated can be changed. The methods that change the attenuation factors alter the coefficents k0, k1 and k2 on the factor 1/( k0 + k1*d + k2*d^2 ) in the OpenGL lighting equation.

PointLight

Construct a new point light node, using the position.

setPosition

public void setPosition(Vector3D position)
Change the position of this light.

Parameters:

setConstantAttenuation

public void setConstantAttenuation(float attenuation)
Set the constant attenuation factor in the OpenGL lighting model. The default value is 1.

Parameters:
attenuation - The new value to use for the constant attenuation coefficient. This must be non-negative.

setLinearAttenuation

public void setLinearAttenuation(float attenuation)
Set the linear attenuation factor in the OpenGL lighting model. The default value is 0.

Parameters:
attenuation - The new value to use for the linear attenuation coefficient. This must be non-negative.

setQuadraticAttenuation

public void setQuadraticAttenuation(float attenuation)
Set the quadratic attenuation factor in the OpenGL lighting model. The default value is 0.

Parameters:
attenuation - The new value to use for the quadratic attenuation coefficient. This must be non-negative.
